intro: Senecio praealtus var. foliosus, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and clustered foliage. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
